intro: Bergeranthus firmus, commonly known as the yellow pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It has palm-like leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Bergeranthus firmus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
